ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I would be able to resist the urge to heavily drink: If I felt that I had let myself down
Notes: 0= Not At All Confident; 20= 20 percent confident; 40= 40 percent confident; 60= 60 percent confident; 80= 80 percent confident; 100= 100 percent, Very Confident

ElementDescription: I would be able to resist the urge to heavily drink: If there were fights at home
Notes: 0= Not At All Confident; 20= 20 percent confident; 40= 40 percent confident; 60= 60 percent confident; 80= 80 percent confident; 100= 100 percent, Very Confident

ElementDescription: I would be able to resist the urge to heavily drink: If I had trouble sleeping

ElementDescription: I would be able to resist the urge to heavily drink: If I had an argument with a friend

ElementDescription: session ID/screening ID
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I would be able to not use drugs other than alcohol if I wanted to share PLEASANT TIMES WITH OTHERS (e.g., if I wanted to have fun with friends, if I was enjoying myself at a party and wanted to feel even better)
Notes: 1 = 0% not at all confident; 2 = 20%; 3 = 40%; 4 = 60%; 5 = 80%; 6 = 100% very confident; 7 = I prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I would be able to not use drugs other than alcohol If I were experiencing UNPLEASANT EMOTIONS (e.g., if I were depressed about things in general; if everything was going badly for me)
Notes: 1 = 0% not at all confident; 2 = 20%; 3 = 40%; 4 = 60%; 5 = 80%; 6 = 100% very confident; 7 = I prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I would be able to not use drugs other than alcohol If I were experiencing PHYSICAL DISCOMFORT (e.g., if I was having trouble sleeping; if I felt jumpy and physically tense)
Notes: 1 = 0% not at all confident; 2 = 20%; 3 = 40%; 4 = 60%; 5 = 80%; 6 = 100% very confident; 7 = I prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I would be able to not use drugs other than alcohol If I were experiencing PLEASANT EMOTIONS (e.g., If something good happened and I felt like celebrating; if everything was going well for me)
Notes: 1 = 0% not at all confident; 2 = 20%; 3 = 40%; 4 = 60%; 5 = 80%; 6 = 100% very confident; 7 = I prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I would be able to not use drugs other than alcohol If I wanted to TEST CONTROL OVER MY USE OF DRUGS (e.g., if I just wanted to try a little bit of a drug; if I just wanted to see what it was like)
Notes: 1 = 0% not at all confident; 2 = 20%; 3 = 40%; 4 = 60%; 5 = 80%; 6 = 100% very confident; 7 = I prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I would be able to not use drugs other than alcohol If I had a strong URGE OR TEMPTATION (e.g., if I suddenly had an urge to use drugs; if I was in a situation where I normally would use drugs)
Notes: 1 = 0% not at all confident; 2 = 20%; 3 = 40%; 4 = 60%; 5 = 80%; 6 = 100% very confident; 7 = I prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I would be able to not use drugs other than alcohol If I was experiencing CONFLICT WITH OTHERS (e.g., if I had an argument with a friend; if I was not getting along well with others at school or work)
Notes: 1 = 0% not at all confident; 2 = 20%; 3 = 40%; 4 = 60%; 5 = 80%; 6 = 100% very confident; 7 = I prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I would be able to not use drugs other than alcohol If I was experiencing SOCIAL PRESSURE to use drugs (e.g., if everyone else was using drugs; if I was invited to a party and was offered drugs)
Notes: 1 = 0% not at all confident; 2 = 20%; 3 = 40%; 4 = 60%; 5 = 80%; 6 = 100% very confident; 7 = I prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: I am confident I can return to reduced drinking even if I drank more heavily for one night.
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I am confident I can return to reduced drinking even if I drank more heavily during my last few nights.
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I am confident I can return to reduced drinking even if I have been drinking more heavily for a long time.
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I feel confident I can keep my drinking at a reduced level even if I experience unpleasant emotions (e.g., If I were depressed about things in general; If everything was going badly for me).
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I feel confident I can keep my drinking at a reduced level even if I experience physical discomfort (e.g., If I would have trouble sleeping; If I felt jumpy and physically tense).
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I feel confident I can keep my drinking at a reduced level even if I experience pleasant emotions (e.g., If something good would happen and I would feel like celebrating; If everything were going well).
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I feel confident I can keep my drinking at a reduced level even if I experience urges and temptations (e.g., If I would suddenly have an urge to drink; If I would be in a situation in which I was in the habit of having a drink).
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I feel confident I can keep my drinking at a reduced level even if I am experiencing conflict with others (e.g., If I had an argument with a friend; If I were not getting along with others at work).
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I feel confident I can keep my drinking at a reduced level even if there is social pressure to drink (e.g., If someone would pressure me to be a good sport and have a drink; If I would be invited to someones home and they would offer me a drink.
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: I feel confident I can keep my drinking at a reduced level even if I am having a pleasant time with others (e.g., If I wanted to celebrate with a friend; If I would be enjoying myself at a party and wanted to feel even better).
Notes: 1= Definitely not; 7= Definitely yes

ElementDescription: Right now, I would be able to resist the urge to drink heavily in situations involving PLEASANT TIMES WITH OTHERS (e.g., if I wanted to celebrate with a friend; if I were enjoying myself at a party and wanted to feel even better).
Notes: 0 = Not At All Confident; 100 = Totally Confident

ElementDescription: Right now, I would be able to resist the urge to drink heavily in situations involving UNPLEASANT EMOTIONS (e.g., if I were depressed about things in general; if everything were going badly for me).
Notes: 0 = Not At All Confident; 100 = Totally Confident

ElementDescription: Right now, I would be able to resist the urge to drink heavily in situations involving PHYSICAL DISCOMFORT (e.g., if I were to have trouble sleeping; if I felt jumpy and physically tense).
Notes: 0 = Not At All Confident; 100 = Totally Confident

ElementDescription: Right now, I would be able to resist the urge to drink heavily in situations involving PLEASANT EMOTIONS (e.g., if something good happened and I felt like celebrating; if everything were going well).
Notes: 0 = Not At All Confident; 100 = Totally Confident

ElementDescription: Right now, I would be able to resist the urge to drink heavily in situations involving TESTING CONTROL OVER MY USE OF ALCOHOL (e.g., if I were to start to believe that alcohol was no longer a problem for me; if I felt confident that I could handle several drinks).
Notes: 0 = Not At All Confident; 100 = Totally Confident

ElementDescription: Right now, I would be able to resist the urge to drink heavily in situations involving URGES AND TEMPTATIONS (e.g., if I suddenly had an urge to drink; if I were in a situation where I had often drank heavily in the past).
Notes: 0 = Not At All Confident; 100 = Totally Confident

ElementDescription: Right now, I would be able to resist the urge to drink heavily in situations involving CONFLICT WITH OTHERS (e.g., if I had an argument with a friend; if I were not getting along well with others at work).
Notes: 0 = Not At All Confident; 100 = Totally Confident

ElementDescription: Right now, I would be able to resist the urge to drink heavily in situations involving SOCIAL PRESSURE TO drink (e.g., if a friend were to pressure me to ''be a good sport'' and drink with him; if I were invited to someone''s home and he offered me a drink).
Notes: 0 = Not At All Confident; 100 = Totally Confident
